poem:
Title: The Stage of Wembley

Beneath the patchwork quilt of London skies,
more than two thousand guardians waiting,
dressed in buttoned armor, reflecting cries.
The Opera of Contention is stating,
as Borussia Dortmund and Real Madrid play,
on the verdant velvet of Wembley, so hushed.
By day, a tempest, by night, a ballet,
with the roar of the crowd, yet so hushed.
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "More than 2,000 officers police protests and Champions League final in London More than 2,000 officers have been deployed across London, including more than 400 from outside the capital, to police the Champions League final, a protest by the far-right activist Tommy Robinson and a counter-demonstration. The final between Borussia Dortmund and Real Madrid takes place at Wembley on Saturday evening. And, earlier, a protest organised by Stephen Yaxley-Lennon, more commonly known as Tommy Robinson,". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
